message: There are only brand new books on this bookshelf.
If the Necronomicon was mixed in with books like this, you’d know it at a glance.
There are only brand-new books on this bookshelf.
If the Necronomicon was mixed in among books like these, you'd recognize it in an instant.
Looks like it's pointless to even search.
It's Penguin Company's 'Classics Series'.
The book itself isn't that old, but it's really beat up.
The previous owner, whether it was a he or a she, probably read this book over and over.
Looks like one of those typical complete works of Shakespeare.
It's not like it's some especially expensive binding, and since it's just one book out of a whole collection, it doesn't seem to have any value at all.
It's John Collins' theology book.
Didn't expect you to have a book by some not-so-famous British theologian.
The owner must have been a devout Christian.
『Suicide is the worst form of murder. Because it doesn't give you a chance to repent.』
That's a word that has absolutely nothing to do with me.
It's not like I have any intention of killing myself or anything.
『Love and Law』
Maria Edgeworth
Sorry to say, but he hasn't been able to read or write since he was a kid.
But just like with other things, you can mark it.
I don't really get what you're trying to say, but......
Come to think of it, can Marsh the old man even read and write?
It's a Chesterton novel.
I read this back when I was still a student, if I remember right.
『Oedipus Rex』
Sophocles
『We saw a swaying noose, and the figure of a woman who had hanged herself.』
ギリシアの作家のようだが名前を聞いた事すらない。
Go back to the archive
